ygData.subject: Re: no prejudices
ygData.msgSnippet: This is a very god point. Especially after you get your new spells. even more so in Cazic Thule..allthough I would wait till at least 20 before venturing
ygData.messageBody:
This is a very god point. Especially after you get your new spells. even
more so in Cazic Thule..allthough I would wait till at least 20 before
venturing there...most of your spells will have no effect on the red
Baddies.

But Cazic Thule is the place to be if you want good loot and exp at around
19 if you have a good group. Remember..the higer your Exp the more valueble
you become!

Auraelle Dracul
The Jewling Wizardette
E'ci
----- Original Message -----
From: Lim Dul <sevendegrees@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, June 04, 1999 4:39 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] no prejudices


> From: Lim Dul <sevendegrees@...>
>
> I agree, good point. On that note, for some of the younger wizards,
you'll
> find a percieved hatred of our class in certain areas...notoriously
because
> of our abilities to strike from afar, and more likely because you are
> playing with others who are ignorant of class balance.
>
> Places that are sometimes hostile to Wizards include BlackBurrow around
the
> Queynos area, and Crushbone over near Felwithe. I would say those in BB
> were more hostile to our class...more sensitive to issues about steal
kills
> and such. Of course, there ARE those wizards I have seen that have used
> their powers to exploit others and place shame on our class. I'd like to
> name names...but.......nah. :)
>
> Once I hit 16...it was amazing how many groups start looking favorable to
> our class. Start looking in areas such as Highhold Pass and Unrest...
> people are always ready to allow a Wizard in the group. So don't dispair
> folks...the wait isn't THAT long. :)
>
> -- Lim'Dul
> 18 Wizard Veeshan
>
